channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why A.I. Fears Are Battering Stocks, Again
item.description: New tools by artificial intelligence companies like Anthropic have reignited worries that businesses will pare down their subscriptions to software se...

item.title: Something broke in the economy in 2023 that explains why so many people are miserable about it, New York Fed says
item.description: Higher-income Americans and those with college degrees have ramped up their spending more quickly in the past three years than other consumers.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie’s Missing Mother Has Nation Fixated on an Arizona Subdivision
item.description: The disappearance of Nancy Guthrie, mother of the news anchor Savannah Guthrie, has reporters, neighbors and drones flooding streets and foothills in ...

item.title: Bedrock, an A.I. Start-Up for Construction, Raises $270 Million
item.description: The two-year-old company, founded by veterans of the autonomous vehicle business Waymo, is seeking to automate excavators and other building equipment...

item.title: Americans are so broke and housing is so expensive that ‘rent now, pay later’ is on the rise
item.description: Companies such as Flex, Livble and, more recently, Affirm, say breaking rent into multiple payments can help renters manage cash flow. Beware, experts...

item.title: Novo Nordisk Warns of First Sales Drop Since Start of Ozempic
item.description: The once high-flying Danish drugmaker has struggled to fend off rivals in the weight-loss industry, especially Eli Lilly, which gave a much rosier out...

item.title: Washington Post Begins Laying Off More Than 300 Journalists
item.description: The layoffs will cut into The Post’s local, international and sports coverage, and reduce the number of all its employees by about 30 percent.

item.title: Trump hit with $16 billion lawsuit for move to cripple New York metro area rail tunnel
item.description: “Allowing this project to stop would put one of the country’s most heavily used transit corridors at risk,” New York AG Letitia James said.

item.title: JD Vance appeals to allies for new ‘trading bloc’ that keeps Trump’s tariffs in place, secures access to rare earths
item.description: “We don’t want to ever go through what we went through a year ago,” Trump said on Monday when announcing Project Vault.

item.title: The ‘Kardashian Kurse’ and a Jurassic Park reunion are among the Super Bowl commercials planned for this year
item.description: Space sold for an average of $8 million per 30-second unit, but a handful of spots sold for $10 million-plus, a record, said NBC VP Peter Lazarus.

item.title: In Afghanistan, a Trail of Hunger and Death Behind U.S. Aid Cuts
item.description: Afghanistan has plunged deeper into a crisis marked by levels of child hunger unseen in 25 years and the closure of almost 450 health centers.

item.title: All About the Epstein Files
item.description: Everyone seems to have questions about the sprawling scandal, so we talked to a reporter who’s been following the case for years.

item.title: Former Prince Andrew Moves Out of Royal Home Amid Fresh Epstein Revelations
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was stripped of his titles last year and told to give up his grand residence because of growing concern over his links to J...

item.title: South Korea Questions Cram School Culture and Childhood Stress
item.description: Academic pressure has become so intense that even preschoolers are taking private extracurricular classes, raising worries about children’s rights.

item.title: Russia and Ukraine Resume Talks After a Huge Attack by Moscow
item.description: U.S., Russian and Ukrainian negotiators are meeting in the United Arab Emirates, but Russia continues to pummel Ukraine and has not softened demands t...
